net.sf.opengroove.client.com
Interface OldStatusListener

public interface OldStatusListener

This classs is a listener interface for listeners that want to receive notifications from a Communicator when the number of users logged in has been updated (but not necesscarily changed) or the userStatusHash has been updated (but not nessecarily chcanged).

Author:
Alexander Boyd

Method Summary
 void allUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
          called when the list of all users is updated.
 void anyUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
          called when any of the user lists are updated.
 void offlineUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
          called when the list of offline users has been updated.
 void onlineUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
          called when the list of online users has been updated.
 void userGone(OldCommunicator c, String arguments)
          indicates that a user has signed off.
 void userHere(OldCommunicator c, String arguments)
          indicates that a user has signed on.
 void userStatusHashChanged(OldCommunicator c)
          called when the user status hash has changed.
 void userStatusHashUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
          called when the user status hash has been updated.
 

Method Detail

allUsersUpdated

void allUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
called when the list of all users is updated.

onlineUsersUpdated

void onlineUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
called when the list of online users has been updated.

offlineUsersUpdated

void offlineUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
called when the list of offline users has been updated.

anyUsersUpdated

void anyUsersUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
called when any of the user lists are updated. this means that this method is called just after any invocation of allUsersChanged(), onlineUsersChanged(), and offlineUsersChanged().

userStatusHashUpdated

void userStatusHashUpdated(OldCommunicator c)
called when the user status hash has been updated.

userStatusHashChanged

void userStatusHashChanged(OldCommunicator c)
called when the user status hash has changed. this means that the Communicator received the user status hash and it was different from the last one it had received.

userHere

void userHere(OldCommunicator c,
              String arguments)
indicates that a user has signed on. in the future, this method will show which user has signed on.

Parameters:
c -
arguments -

userGone

void userGone(OldCommunicator c,
              String arguments)
indicates that a user has signed off. in the future, this mtehod will show which user has signed off.
